positioning.title:
Evolved CRM Systems.
High Complexity.
Clear Solutions.
positioning.text: Challenges in CRM systems are rarely purely technical. Often, what's missing is clean solution architecture, clear responsibilities, or resilient integration concepts. I help organizations structure Salesforce landscapes, make decision options visible, and establish systems that are sustainable long-term.

profile.title: Profile.
profile.p1: I've been working with Salesforce, CRM, and cloud systems for over ten years — from operational administration to responsibility for complex solution and integration landscapes in enterprise and mid-market environments.
profile.p2: In roles as Salesforce Solution Architect, Senior Administrator, and external consultant, I have designed, restructured, migrated, and operated systems stably over several years.
profile.p3: My focus is on solution design and decision work: structuring requirements, cleanly defining system boundaries, securing integrations, and evaluating technical options under real organizational conditions.

philosophy.p1: I work where CRM systems are business-critical and technical decisions have long-term impact.
philosophy.p2: My standard is clarity: comprehensible solution architecture, resilient integrations, and decisions that teams can sustain long-term.
philosophy.p3: Good CRM solutions don't emerge from tool focus, but from clean interplay of processes, data, and responsibilities.

cta.title: Let's Talk.
cta.text: Whether architecture review, solution design, or decision support — I look forward to your message.

architecture.subtitle: What I deliver:
points: Clearly structured solution architecture with defined system boundaries and integration paths
Security, identity, and authorization concepts that remain sustainable during growth
Rollout and migration paths with realistic, verifiable milestones
architecture.longtext1: I analyze existing Salesforce landscapes, functional requirements, and organizational constraints to derive resilient solution architectures. The goal is not abstract target drawings, but solutions that function in daily operations and remain evolvable.
architecture.longtext2: I systematically incorporate org health, governance, security concepts, and integrations. Recommendations are not generic but oriented to business model, team structure, and realistic timelines.

crm.subtitle: Focus Areas
points: Integration concepts to ERP, middleware, and specialized systems (REST, Events, Auth)
Definition of clear interface contracts, monitoring, and operational concepts
Data flow and responsibility models across system and team boundaries
crm.longtext: I help integrate CRM systems so that data flows remain comprehensible, operational risks are reduced, and teams can work efficiently. The goal is a system network that promotes acceptance rather than creating additional complexity.

points: Domain boundaries and data models along functional responsibilities
Automations and flows with clear guardrails and testability
Reporting and KPI structures for informed decision support
product.longtext: Clean data models and processes form the foundation of every scalable CRM solution. I help clearly represent business logic, keep automations manageable, and purposefully reduce technical debt.

ownership.subtitle: What Responsibility Means:
points: Clear assignment of technical and functional responsibility for systems and data
Documented decisions with comprehensible justification and consideration
Governance models that sustain beyond individuals and project phases
ownership.longtext1: Responsibility doesn't end with a recommendation. I support organizations in making and documenting technical decisions so they remain sustainable long-term.
ownership.longtext2: Whether point decision assurance, temporary assumption of technical responsibility, or support in building clear ownership models across distributed teams — my focus is on ensuring responsibilities are unambiguous and decisions endure.

faq.title: Questions? Answers.
faq.subtitle: Typical situations and approaches, described from practice.

items.question: Salesforce and CRM landscapes have evolved organically and are difficult to maintain.
items.answer: In such situations, I analyze existing Salesforce orgs, connected systems, and real usage patterns in operations. I make technical dependencies, implicit assumptions, and evolved special logic visible and classify them functionally and technically. The result is a clear solution architecture that shows which parts need to be stabilized, simplified, or redesigned without endangering ongoing operations.

items.question: Multiple solution or integration options are under consideration, but risks and impacts are unclear.
items.answer: I prepare structured decision foundations in which technical options become comparable. This includes trade-offs, integration risks, impacts on operations, data quality and team structures, as well as realistic migration paths. The goal is a decision that is made comprehensibly and endures even under time and organizational pressure.

items.question: Product, Business, and IT have different visions for the same CRM system.
items.answer: I structure requirements, target architectures, and constraints across all involved roles and translate them into a common solution understanding. I clarify what the system should do, what it deliberately should not, and where functional responsibility lies. Decisions are documented and made so they can be supported and implemented by the involved teams.

items.question: Long-Standing Experience
items.answer: I've been working with Salesforce, CRM, and integration systems for over ten years in enterprise and mid-market environments. My experience ranges from operational administration through complex migrations to responsibility for solution design, integrations, and long-term stable system landscapes.

items.question: Strategic Clarity
items.answer: Technical decisions don't emerge implicitly or purely tool-driven with me. I expose assumptions, evaluate alternatives, and formulate clear decision options that consider functional, technical, and organizational impacts. This creates transparency and reduces subsequent corrections.

items.question: Measurable Impact
items.answer: The focus is on stable systems, better user acceptance, and resilient processes. Solutions are designed to ease daily operations, reduce technical debt, and measurably support decisions rather than create new complexity.

items.question: Practical Implementation
items.answer: All solutions are oriented to real teams, existing capabilities, and operational constraints. The goal is not theoretical ideal architecture, but a system that functions in daily operations, remains maintainable, and can be evolved incrementally.

references.intro: Selected projects from Salesforce, CRM, integrations, and cloud architecture. The brief description provides context, the detailed view describes concrete architecture decisions, system boundaries, and technical responsibility.
references.description: Selected projects from Salesforce, CRM, integrations, and cloud architecture.

baywa.name: BayWa AG
baywa.description: Design of a custom middleware architecture to replace manual processes and ensure consistent data.
baywa.detail:
Responsible for conception and implementation of tailored middleware between ERP, CRM, and third-party systems.

Key Focus:
- Analysis of existing manual and semi-automated processes
- Definition of clear system boundaries and ownership per data object
- API design for stable, comprehensible data flows
- Introduction of parallel operation (phased rollout) for risk minimization
- Monitoring and error concept for operational security

The result was a scalable integration architecture with high data integrity and significantly reduced manual rework.

peek.name: Peek & Cloppenburg
peek.description: Development of customer experience with Salesforce Experience Cloud.
peek.detail:
Architectural consulting and implementation around Experience Cloud to improve cross-channel customer experience.

Key Focus:
- Structuring of data, role, and permission concepts
- Conception of personalized journeys based on consistent customer data
- Governance for content, data maintenance, and responsibilities
- Connection of marketing, service, and CRM perspectives

Focus was less on individual features but on a sustainable overall system that remains maintainable long-term.

sennder.name: sennder GmbH
sennder.description: Modeling of new objects and processes for operational optimization and system stability.
sennder.detail:
Responsible for restructuring data models and processes in an integration-intensive environment.

Key Focus:
- Modeling new Salesforce objects to represent operational processes
- Ensuring consistent data between CRM, VoIP, and other systems
- Consulting on GDPR-compliant data storage and access concepts
- Documentation of cross-system processes and responsibilities

The goal was to make operational workflows comprehensible, stable, and understandable across organizations.

meinestadt.name: meinestadt.de
meinestadt.description: Migration from Salesforce Classic to Lightning and development of custom LWCs.
meinestadt.detail:
Support of technical and organizational migration from Salesforce Classic to Lightning Experience.

Key Focus:
- Planning a phased rollout (wave approach)
- Operation of a shadow mode phase to secure daily operations
- Development of reusable Lightning Web Components
- Consulting on architecture decisions and legacy refactoring
- Enablement of internal admins through documentation and training

The focus was on risk-minimized migration with long-term maintainable architecture.

nordmetall.name: NORDMETALL
nordmetall.description: Technical leadership in conception and implementation of a new web platform.
nordmetall.detail:
Assumption of overall technical responsibility for a new web platform.

Key Focus:
- Definition of system architecture and migration path
- Technical coordination with editorial, marketing, and external service providers
- KPI definition for reach, structure, and conversion
- Ensuring a scalable, maintainable code and system base

The goal was a platform that meets both editorial and business requirements.

bundesverband.name: Bundesverband Geothermie
bundesverband.description: Introduction of a CRM system including data structure and user training.
bundesverband.detail:
Conception and introduction of a CRM system to replace distributed individual tools.

Key Focus:
- Definition of a clean data model and clear maintenance responsibility
- Permission and role concept for different user groups
- Planning and execution of user training
- Support of organizational adoption

The focus was on acceptance, data quality, and long-term usability.

tuev.name: TÜV Thüringen
tuev.description: Digitalization and optimization of inspection processes with Salesforce.
tuev.detail:
Consulting and implementation in field service and mobile process environment.

Key Focus:

- Stabilization of operational workflows through clean data flows

The goal was a robust, practical solution for field service.

nordicdent.description: Building a scalable sales and service architecture.
nordicdent.detail:
